means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 赫德尔 Hudd的昵称

sentence.Network_en: Between plays the coach was talking to the offense in the huddle.
sentence.Network_cn: 中场时，这位教练对围拢一圈的进攻队员进行战术指导。

sentence.Network_en: I remembered a huddle of stone buildings with blind walls.
sentence.Network_cn: 我记得一片没有窗户的石头建筑。

sentence.Network_en: We lay there: a huddle of bodies, gasping for air.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们横七竖八地挤作一团躺在那里，大口喘着气。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)get close to one or more people so as to speak about private or secret matters
jx.jx_cn_mean: 凑近(某人)说悄悄话；交头接耳

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'conceal'): perhaps of Low German origin

entry.tran: （通常因寒冷或恐惧而）蜷缩，缩成一团
entry.def: If you huddle somewhere, you sit, stand, or lie there holding your arms and legs close to your body, usually because you are cold or frightened.

example.ex: She huddled inside the porch as she rang the bell...
example.tran: 她按门铃时身子在门廊里缩成一团。

example.ex: Myrtle sat huddled on the side of the bed, weeping.
example.tran: 默特尔缩着身子坐在床边哭泣。

entry.tran: （通常因寒冷或恐惧而）聚在一起，挤成一团
entry.def: If people huddle together or huddle round something, they stand, sit, or lie close to each other, usually because they all feel cold or frightened.

example.ex: Tired and lost, we huddled together...
example.tran: 我们疲惫不堪，又迷了路，于是大家都挤在一起。
挤作一团取暖的陌生人

entry.def: If people huddle in a group, they gather together to discuss something quietly or secretly.

example.ex: Off to one side, Sticht, Macomber, Jordan, and Kreps huddled to discuss something...
example.tran: 施蒂希特、麦康伯、乔丹和克雷普斯走到一旁私下商量着什么。

example.ex: The president has been huddling with his most senior aides...
example.tran: 总统一直在和最高层助理开私下碰头会。

entry.tran: 拥挤的一群;杂乱的一堆
entry.def: A huddle is a small group of people or things that are standing very close together or lying on top of each other, usually in a disorganized way.

example.ex: We lay there: a huddle of bodies, gasping for air...
example.tran: 我们横七竖八地挤作一团躺在那里，大口喘着气。

example.ex: Les kept seeing Eric and Tam in a huddle and he knew they were talking about him.
example.tran: 莱斯总是看到埃里克和塔姆凑在一起，他知道他们是在谈论自己。

means.word_mean: 2. a disorganized and densely packed crowd;

auth_sentence.content: Sometimes he and Mom would huddle in the kitchen.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sometimes he and Mom would huddle in the kitchen.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sometimes he and Mom would huddle in the kitchen.

auth_sentence.content: In the distance, a huddle of slate rooftops.
auth_sentence.res_content: In the distance, a huddle of slate rooftops.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In the distance, a huddle of slate rooftops.

auth_sentence.content: Elderly residents huddle under piles of blankets to keep warm.
auth_sentence.res_content: Elderly residents huddle under piles of blankets to keep warm.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Elderly residents huddle under piles of blankets to keep warm.

means.word_mean: (尤指杂乱地)挤在一起的人(或物品、建筑）

sentences.cn: 人们三五成群地到处聚集着。

sentences.en: The track led them to a huddle of barns and outbuildings.
sentences.cn: 那条路把他们带到一片杂乱拥挤的谷仓和库房。

means.word_mean: (人或动物)(通常因寒冷或害怕)挤在一起

sentences.en: They all huddled around the fire.
People huddled up close to each other.
sentences.cn: 人们紧紧地相互偎在一起.

means.word_mean: （通常因寒冷或害怕）蜷缩，缩成一团

sentences.en: I huddled under a blanket on the floor.
sentences.cn: 我在地板上盖着毯子缩成一团。

jushi.english: The house is very small and cannot huddle all of us.
jushi.chinese: 房子太小了,挤不下我们所有的人。

jushi.english: The enemy huddled all the people.
jushi.chinese: 敌人让所有的群众都挤在一起。

jushi.english: You cannot huddle all the dogs, they will bit each other.
jushi.chinese: 不要把所有的狗都放在一起,它们会互相咬的。
